tiles.title: CSS Support Cases
tiles.query:
range TimeStamp from todatetime("09-01-2018") to now() step 1d
| summarize by TimeStamp=endofmonth(TimeStamp)
| join kind=leftouter
(
    KPISupportData
    | summarize CasesCreated = count() by TimeStamp=endofmonth(CreatedDateTime)
) on TimeStamp
| join kind=leftouter 
(
    KPISupportData
    | summarize CasesClosed = count() by TimeStamp=endofmonth(ClosedDateTime)
) on TimeStamp
| project TimeStamp, CasesCreated, CasesClosed

tiles.title: Cases distribution by topics
tiles.query:
KPISupportData
| where datetime_part("Year",CreatedDateTime) >= datetime_part("Year",now(-60d))
| extend Month = datetime_part("Month",CreatedDateTime)
| where Month >= datetime_part("Month",now())-2
| summarize Count=count() by SupportTopicL2, Month
| order by Count

tiles.title: Total Cases

KPISupportData
| summarize count()

tiles.title: Open Cases
tiles.query:
KPISupportData
| where isempty(ClosedDateTime)
| summarize count()

tiles.title: Cases by Severity
tiles.query:
KPISupportData
| summarize Count=count() by Severity

tiles.title: CSAT
tiles.query:
## Customer Satisfaction Score (CSAT) 
#### *Low < 4.5*, *Medium >= 4.5 & <4.62*, *Good > 4.62*

tiles.title: CSAT Scores
tiles.query:
let ReportingPeriod = startofmonth(datetime_add('month', -3, now()));
range Timestamp from datetime_add('month', -3, now()) to now() step 1d
| summarize by Timestamp=startofmonth(Timestamp)
| join kind=leftouter
(KPISupportData
| where startofmonth(ClosedDateTime) >= ReportingPeriod
| extend CSAT = iif(isempty(TotalCsatScore), TotalChatCSATScore, TotalCsatScore)
| summarize CSAT=round(avg(CSAT),2), CaseCount=countif(isnotempty(CSAT)) by Month=startofmonth(ClosedDateTime)
) on $left.Timestamp == $right.Month
| order by Timestamp asc
| extend CSAT = iif(isempty(CSAT), 0.0, CSAT)
| extend CaseCount = iif(isempty(CaseCount),0, CaseCount)
| extend Month=format_datetime(Timestamp, "MM-yyyy")

tiles.title: Low CSAT Tickets (current month)
tiles.query:
KPISupportData
| where startofmonth(ClosedDateTime) == startofmonth(now())
| extend CSAT = iif(isempty(TotalCsatScore), TotalChatCSATScore, TotalCsatScore)
| where isnotempty(CSAT)
| where CSAT < 4.62
| extend ServiceDeskLink = strcat("https://elixir.microsoft.com/case-review/", IncidentId)
| extend IsARR = iif(ServiceName in ("Rapid Response - Premier","Rapid Response - Unified","Premier - Mission Critical","Mission Critical - Unified","Azure Rapid Response Restricted","Azure Advanced Support for Startups","Performance Support"), "Yes","No")
| project IncidentId, ServiceDeskLink, CSAT, Customer,CreatedDateTime, ClosedDateTime, Severity, Title, ResourceUri, SupportTopicL2, SupportTopicL3, RelatedLSI_IDs, AgentAlias, IsARR

tiles.title: Top 10 customers with low CSAT
tiles.query:
let lastMonth = startofmonth(datetime_add('month', -1, now()));
KPISupportData
| extend CSAT = iif(isempty(TotalCsatScore), TotalChatCSATScore, TotalCsatScore)
| summarize TotalCases=count(), OverallAvg=round(avg(CSAT), 2), LastMonthAvg=round(avgif(CSAT, startofmonth(ClosedDateTime) == lastMonth),2) by Customer
| where OverallAvg < 4.62
| top 10 by TotalCases
| order by OverallAvg asc

tiles.title: Top 10 Support Topics CSAT score
tiles.query:
let lastMonth = startofmonth(datetime_add('month', -1, now()));
KPISupportData
| extend CSAT = iif(isempty(TotalCsatScore), TotalChatCSATScore, TotalCsatScore)
| summarize TotalCases=count(), OverallAvg=round(avg(CSAT), 2), LastMonthAvg=round(avgif(CSAT, startofmonth(ClosedDateTime) == lastMonth),2) by SupportTopicL2
| where isnan(OverallAvg) == false
| top 10 by OverallAvg asc
| project SupportTopicL2, TotalCases, OverallAvg, LastMonthAvg

tiles.title: Active CSS SR
tiles.query:
let lastMonth = startofmonth(datetime_add('month', -1, now()));
KPISupportData
| where State == "Open"
| project IncidentId, Title, ResourceUri,SupportTopicL2, SupportTopicL3, Customer, CreatedDateTime, State
| extend CreateTimespan = now() - CreatedDateTime
| extend CreateAge = iff(State == 'Open', iff(CreateTimespan < time(1d), ' 0', 
                    iff(CreateTimespan < time(2d), ' 1', 
                    iff(CreateTimespan < time(3d), ' 2', 
                    iff(CreateTimespan < time(4d), ' 3', 
                    iff(CreateTimespan < time(5d), ' 4', 
                    iff(CreateTimespan < time(6d), ' 5', 
                    iff(CreateTimespan < time(7d), ' 6', 
                    iff(CreateTimespan < time(8d), ' 7', 
                    iff(CreateTimespan < time(9d), ' 8',
                    iff(CreateTimespan < time(10d), ' 9',
                    iff(CreateTimespan < time(11d), '10',
                    iff(CreateTimespan < time(12d), '11',
                    iff(CreateTimespan < time(13d), '12',
                    iff(CreateTimespan < time(14d), '13',
                    iff(CreateTimespan < time(15d), '14','14+'))))))))))))))), ' ')
| project-away CreateTimespan
| order by CreatedDateTime asc

tiles.title: IPD
tiles.query:
let IPDGoals=datatable(Month:datetime , IPDGoal:double)[datetime("07-01-2020"), 5.79,datetime("08-01-2020"), 6.10, datetime("09-01-2020"), 6.33,datetime("10-01-2020"),6.38,datetime("11-01-2020"),6.68,datetime("12-01-2020"),5.30,datetime("01-01-2021"),6.37,datetime("02-01-2021"),6.69,datetime("03-01-2021"),6.96,datetime("04-01-2021"),6.98,datetime("05-01-2021"),7.31,datetime("06-01-2021"),7.54,datetime("07-01-2021"),7.54,datetime("08-01-2021"),7.54,datetime("09-01-2021"),7.54,datetime("10-01-2021"),7.54, datetime("11-01-2021"),7.54] ;
KPISupportData
    | where CreatedDateTime > startofmonth(ago(365d))
    | summarize CasesCreated = count() by TimeStamp=bin(CreatedDateTime, 1d)
| summarize IPD=avg(CasesCreated) by Month=startofmonth(TimeStamp)
| join (IPDGoals | extend Month=startofmonth(Month)) on Month
| extend GoalMet = iif(IPDGoal >= IPD, "Yes", "No")
| order by Month asc 
| project Month=format_datetime(Month, "MM-yyyy"), IPD, IPDGoal

tiles.title: IPD (Incidents per day)
tiles.query: ## Incident (IPD) Actuals -Incidents per day for the service

tiles.title: IPD actual (goal)
tiles.query:
let ReportingPeriod = startofmonth(datetime_add('month', -3, now()));
let IPDGoals=datatable(Month:datetime , IPDGoal:double)[datetime("07-01-2020"), 5.79,datetime("08-01-2020"), 6.10, datetime("09-01-2020"), 6.33,datetime("10-01-2020"),6.38,datetime("11-01-2020"),6.68,datetime("12-01-2020"),5.30,datetime("01-01-2021"),6.37,datetime("02-01-2021"),6.69,datetime("03-01-2021"),6.96,datetime("04-01-2021"),6.98,datetime("05-01-2021"),7.05,datetime("06-01-2021"),7.14,datetime("07-01-2021"),18.82, datetime("08-01-2021"),18.82,datetime("09-01-2021"),19.05,datetime("10-01-2021"),19.52,datetime("11-01-2021"),19.05,datetime("12-01-2021"),16.61,datetime("01-01-2022"),18.67,datetime("02-01-2022"),19.35,datetime("03-01-2022"),17.87,datetime("04-01-2022"),18.76,datetime("05-01-2022"),18.23,datetime("06-01-2022"),18.32];
range Timestamp from datetime_add('month', -3, now()) to now() step 1d
| summarize by Timestamp=startofmonth(Timestamp)
| join kind=leftouter
(
KPISupportData
    | where CreatedDateTime > ReportingPeriod
    | summarize CasesCreated=count() by Month=startofmonth(CreatedDateTime)
    | lookup MonthToWorkDay on $left.Month == $right.Month
    | extend IPD = toreal(CasesCreated)/toreal(WorkDays)
) on $left.Timestamp == $right.Month
| extend Month=startofmonth(Timestamp)
| join (IPDGoals | extend Month=startofmonth(Month)) on Month
| extend GoalMet = iif(IPDGoal >= iif(isempty(IPD), 0.0, IPD), "Yes", "No")
| project Month=format_datetime(Timestamp, "MM-yyyy"), IPD=strcat(round(IPD,2), "(", IPDGoal, ")"), GoalMet, IPDGoal

tiles.title: IPD (Last Month)
tiles.query:
let ReportingPeriod = startofmonth(datetime_add('month', -1, now()));
let CurrentMonth = startofmonth(now());
let IPDGoals=datatable(Month:datetime , IPDGoal:double)[datetime("07-01-2020"), 5.79,datetime("08-01-2020"), 6.10, datetime("09-01-2020"), 6.33,datetime("10-01-2020"),6.38,datetime("11-01-2020"),6.68,datetime("12-01-2020"),5.30,datetime("01-01-2021"),6.37,datetime("02-01-2021"),6.69,datetime("03-01-2021"),6.96,datetime("04-01-2021"),6.98,datetime("05-01-2021"),7.05,datetime("06-01-2021"),7.14,datetime("07-01-2021"),18.82, datetime("08-01-2021"),18.82,datetime("09-01-2021"),19.05,datetime("10-01-2021"),19.52,datetime("11-01-2021"),19.05,datetime("12-01-2021"),16.61,datetime("01-01-2022"),18.67,datetime("02-01-2022"),19.35,datetime("03-01-2022"),17.87,datetime("04-01-2022"),18.76,datetime("05-01-2022"),18.23,datetime("06-01-2022"),18.32];
KPISupportData
    | where CreatedDateTime >= ReportingPeriod and CreatedDateTime < CurrentMonth
    | summarize CasesCreated = count() by Month=startofmonth(CreatedDateTime)
| lookup MonthToWorkDay on $left.Month == $right.Month
    | extend IPD = toreal(CasesCreated)/toreal(WorkDays)
| extend Value = "Actual"
| join (IPDGoals | where Month >= ReportingPeriod and Month < CurrentMonth | extend Month = startofmonth(Month)) on Month
| extend GoalMet = iif(IPDGoal >= IPD, "Yes", "No")
| project Month, IPD, Value, GoalMet
| union (IPDGoals | where Month >= ReportingPeriod and Month < CurrentMonth | extend Value = "Target" | extend IPD=IPDGoal | extend GoalMet = "") 
| project Month=format_datetime(Month, "MM-yyyy"), IPD=round(IPD,2), Value,  GoalMet

tiles.title: IPD (Current Month)
tiles.query:
let CurrentMonth = startofmonth(now());
let IPDGoals=datatable(Month:datetime , IPDGoal:double)[datetime("07-01-2020"), 5.79,datetime("08-01-2020"), 6.10, datetime("09-01-2020"), 6.33,datetime("10-01-2020"),6.38,datetime("11-01-2020"),6.68,datetime("12-01-2020"),5.30,datetime("01-01-2021"),6.37,datetime("02-01-2021"),6.69,datetime("03-01-2021"),6.96,datetime("04-01-2021"),6.98,datetime("05-01-2021"),7.05,datetime("06-01-2021"),7.14,datetime("07-01-2021"),18.82, datetime("08-01-2021"),18.82,datetime("09-01-2021"),19.05,datetime("10-01-2021"),19.52,datetime("11-01-2021"),19.05,datetime("12-01-2021"),16.61,datetime("01-01-2022"),18.67,datetime("02-01-2022"),19.35,datetime("03-01-2022"),17.87,datetime("04-01-2022"),18.76,datetime("05-01-2022"),18.23,datetime("06-01-2022"),18.32];
print CurrentMonth=CurrentMonth
| join kind=leftouter (
KPISupportData
    | where CreatedDateTime >= CurrentMonth
     | summarize CasesCreated = count() by Month=startofmonth(CreatedDateTime)
| lookup MonthToWorkDay on $left.Month == $right.Month
    | extend IPD = toreal(CasesCreated)/toreal(WorkDays)
) on $left.CurrentMonth == $right.Month
| extend Value = "Actual"
| extend IPD = iif(isempty(IPD), 0.0,IPD)
| join (IPDGoals | where Month == CurrentMonth | extend Month = startofmonth(Month)) on $left.CurrentMonth == $right.Month
| extend GoalMet = iif(IPDGoal >= iif(isempty(IPD), 0.0,IPD), "Yes", "No")
| project Month, IPD, Value, GoalMet
| union (IPDGoals | where Month == CurrentMonth | extend Value = "Target" | extend IPD=IPDGoal | extend GoalMet = "") 
| project Month=format_datetime(CurrentMonth, "MM-yyyy"), IPD=round(IPD,2), Value,  GoalMet

tiles.query:
### Rate of incidents against the expected usage growth of a service/service group for a given time period (typically the month)
#### Normalized Incident Rate=(( Actual Incident volume )/(@Usage) )

tiles.title: Usage (Consumption Units)
tiles.query:
P360UsageData
| where Timestamp > ago(365d)
| order by Timestamp asc
| extend Timestamp = format_datetime(Timestamp, "MM-yyyy")

tiles.title: NIR (by month)
tiles.query:
P360UsageData
| where Timestamp > endofmonth(ago(365d))
| extend Month = endofmonth(Timestamp)
| join (
KPISupportData
    | where CreatedDateTime > endofmonth(ago(365d))
    | summarize CasesCreated = count() by TimeStamp=bin(CreatedDateTime, 1d)
    | summarize IPD=avg(CasesCreated) by Month=endofmonth(TimeStamp)
) on Month
| extend NIR = round(IPD/Quantity*10000000, 2)
| order by Month asc
| project Month=format_datetime(Month, "MM-yyyy"), NIR

tiles.title: Support Engineer Time (SET)
tiles.query:
## Actual Avg of total minutes spent for a service
### Target - 121 mins

tiles.title: SET Time
tiles.query:
let ReportingPeriod = startofmonth(datetime_add('month', -3, now()));
range Timestamp from datetime_add('month', -3, now()) to now() step 1d
| summarize by Timestamp=startofmonth(Timestamp)
| join kind=leftouter
(
KPISupportData
| where startofmonth(ClosedDateTime) >= ReportingPeriod 
| summarize SET=round(sum(TotalLabourMinutes)), CaseCount=count() by Month=startofmonth(ClosedDateTime)
| extend AvgSET = round(SET/CaseCount, 2)
) on $left.Timestamp == $right.Month
| extend AvgSET = iif(isempty(AvgSET), 0.0, AvgSET)
| order by Timestamp asc
| extend Month=format_datetime(Timestamp, "MM-yyyy")

let CurrentMonth = startofmonth(now());
KPISupportData
| where startofmonth(ClosedDateTime) >= ReportingPeriod and startofmonth(ClosedDateTime) < CurrentMonth
| where TotalLabourMinutes > 121
| extend ServiceDeskLink = strcat("https://servicedesk.microsoft.com/#/customer/case/", IncidentId)
| project IncidentId, ServiceDeskLink, SET=TotalLabourMinutes, CreatedDateTime, ClosedDateTime, Severity, Title, ResourceUri, SupportTopicL2, SupportTopicL3, Customer, RelatedLSI_IDs
| order by SET desc

tiles.query:
let ReportingPeriod = startofmonth(datetime_add('month', -1, now()));
let CurrentMonth = startofmonth(now());
KPISupportData
| where startofmonth(ClosedDateTime) >= ReportingPeriod and startofmonth(ClosedDateTime) < CurrentMonth
| summarize SET=round(sum(TotalLabourMinutes)), CaseCount=count()
| extend AvgSET = round(SET/CaseCount, 2)
| project "SET (Last Month)",AvgSET

tiles.title: SET
tiles.query:
let CurrentMonth = startofmonth(now());
print CurrentMonth=CurrentMonth
| join kind=leftouter
(
KPISupportData
| where startofmonth(ClosedDateTime) >= CurrentMonth
| summarize SET=round(sum(TotalLabourMinutes)), CaseCount=count() by Month=startofmonth(ClosedDateTime)
| extend AvgSET = round(SET/CaseCount, 2)
) on $left.CurrentMonth == $right.Month
| extend AvgSET = iif(isempty(AvgSET), 0.0, AvgSET)
| project "SET (Currrent Month)",AvgSET

tiles.title: High SET Tickets (Current month)
tiles.query:
let CurrentMonth = startofmonth(now());
KPISupportData
| where startofmonth(ClosedDateTime) == CurrentMonth
| where TotalLabourMinutes > 121
| extend ServiceDeskLink = strcat("https://servicedesk.microsoft.com/#/customer/case/", IncidentId)
| project IncidentId, ServiceDeskLink, SET=TotalLabourMinutes, CreatedDateTime, ClosedDateTime, Severity, Title, ResourceUri, SupportTopicL2, SupportTopicL3, Customer, RelatedLSI_IDs
| order by SET desc

tiles.title: ASC Usage (Public)
tiles.query:
## % of cases where support center was used
### Target - 100%

tiles.title: ASC Usage
tiles.query:
let ReportingPeriod = startofmonth(datetime_add('month', -3, now()));
let CurrentMonth = startofmonth(now());
range Timestamp from datetime_add('month', -3, now()) to now() step 1d
| summarize by Timestamp=startofmonth(Timestamp)
| join kind=leftouter
(
cluster('u360sec').database('KPISupportData').ASCUsageData
| where ProductId == 16602 and startofmonth(ClosedDateTime) >= ReportingPeriod
| summarize countif(Sum_AscLookup > 0), TotalCount=count() by Month=startofmonth(ClosedDateTime)
| extend ASCUsage = round(1.0*countif_/TotalCount*100.0, 2)
) on $left.Timestamp == $right.Month
| extend ASCUsage = iif(isempty(ASCUsage), 0.0, ASCUsage)
| order by Timestamp asc
| project Month=format_datetime(Timestamp, "MM-yyyy"), ASCUsage,ASCUsageDisplay=strcat(ASCUsage, "%")

tiles.title: Critical Insights Coverage
tiles.query:
## % of support requests where potential cases solving insight was presented
### Target - 50%

tiles.title: Critical Insights Coverage
tiles.query:
let ReportingPeriod = startofmonth(datetime_add('month', -3, now()));
let CurrentMonth = startofmonth(now());
range Timestamp from datetime_add('month', -3, now()) to now() step 1d
| summarize by Timestamp=startofmonth(Timestamp)
| join kind=leftouter
(
cluster('u360sec').database('KPISupportData').ASCInsightsData
| where ProductId == 16602 and startofmonth(ClosedDateTime) >= ReportingPeriod
| summarize countif(CountOfCriticalInsights > 0), TotalCount=count() by Month=startofmonth(ClosedDateTime)
| extend CriticalInsights = round(1.0*countif_/TotalCount*100.0, 2)
) on $left.Timestamp == $right.Month
| extend CriticalInsights = iif(isempty(CriticalInsights), 0.0, CriticalInsights)
| order by Timestamp asc
| project Month=format_datetime(Timestamp, "MM-yyyy"), CriticalInsights,CriticalInsightsDisplay=strcat(CriticalInsights, "%")

tiles.title: Case Reviews
tiles.query:
## # of Support cases reviewed in a given month
10% of case volume or 100 cases (90% of case volumes for teams with monthly closed volume under 100 cases)

tiles.title: Case Reviews
tiles.query:
range Month from startofmonth(datetime_add('month', -3, now())) to startofmonth(now()) step 1d
| summarize by Month = startofmonth(Month)
| join kind=leftouter (ElixirCases | summarize TotalCases=count() by Month=startofmonth(CaseCreatedDate)) on Month
| join kind=leftouter (ElixirCases
| summarize TotalCasesReviewed=count() by Month=startofmonth(CaseReviewCompletedDate)
) on Month
| order by Month asc
| project Month=format_datetime(Month, "MM-yyyy"), TotalCases,TotalCasesReviewed
| extend Goal = iif(TotalCases > 100, 100.0, 0.9*TotalCases)
| extend TotalCasesReviewed = iif(isempty(TotalCasesReviewed), 0, TotalCasesReviewed)
| extend GoalMet = iif(Goal > TotalCasesReviewed, "No", "Yes")
| project Month, TotalCasesReviewed, GoalMet

tiles.title: CasesReviews (Last Month)
tiles.query:
let ReportingPeriod = startofmonth(datetime_add('month', -1, now()));
let CurrentMonth = startofmonth(now());
ElixirCases 
| where startofmonth(CaseCreatedDate) >= ReportingPeriod and startofmonth(CaseCreatedDate) < CurrentMonth
| summarize TotalCases=count() by Month=startofmonth(CaseCreatedDate)
| join kind=leftouter
(ElixirCases
| summarize TotalCasesReviewed=count() by Month=startofmonth(CaseReviewCompletedDate)
) on Month
| order by Month asc
| extend TotalCasesReviewed = iif(isempty(TotalCasesReviewed), 0, TotalCasesReviewed)
| extend Goal = iif(TotalCases > 100, 100.0, 0.9*TotalCases)
| extend GoalMet = iif(TotalCasesReviewed < Goal, "No", "Yes")
| project TotalCases, TotalCasesReviewed, GoalMet
| evaluate narrow()
| project-away Row

tiles.title: CSAT Deep dive feedback
tiles.query:
### June 2022

SR **2206060030000979** - Networking issue connecting to Public URL on VNet Injected cluster. Issue was exculated to networking team and properly handled.

SR **2206200050000484** - Hotfix required to be pushed to cluster to resolve unexted behavior.

### May 2022

SR **2204210050004410** - Migration from v2 to v3. Handled correctly.

SR **2204210050000111** - Customer attempting to ingest data from storage using 1Click with the access via SAS disabled. Informed customer that this isn't a supported configuration.

### March 2022

SR **2203100040001709** - Customer was upset because he thought case wasn't assigned to a engineer. This was an ARR case and the assigned engineer sent an email to the customer same day. Case set because there was no reply. 

SR **2203130050000004** - Case handled properly and promptly by support engineer. Syntax issue with purge command.

### Feb 2022

SR# **2112130040006688** - Attempting to connect to PE on SQL Server but lacked the DNS configuration on the VNET ADX was deployed to. I believe the low CSAT was due to the TTM. It was open in Dec and closed in Feb.

SR# **2201130050000435** - Customer was confused on how a table row order policy worked along with the take operator. Customer talked directly to an engineer and was satisfied with answers given.

### Jan 2022

SR# **2112150040006902** - Customer getting ingestion failures trying to pull from Blob Storage. Case handled correctly and proper mitigation steps given. Due to storage throttling.

### Dec 2021

SR# **2111110060000611** - Customers cluster encountered two critical issues within 3 days, impacted customer business and made them feels anxious with ADX.
CSAT 3 - SR 2111090060002164 / IcM 271294587: ADX execution by API failed, issue happened around 2021-11-09 09:00 ~ 22:20 UTC+8
CSAT 4 - SR 2111110060000611 / IcM 271648859: Query Performance, issue happened around 2021-11-11 09:00 ~ 11:00 AM UTC+8
But the main concern of the case 2111110060000611 is that customer was using incorrect way on query workload then leads query perf issue.
This is caused by our documentation and product feature wasnt matched; thus, customers were unable to follow the right path for their implementation. Confirmed this discrepancy with PG team and customers during remote session, then PG team fixed the product issue and corrected the documentation.

### Nov 2021
SR# **2111180050001859** - Customer seeing slow query performance. Escalated to operations who determined that optimizations in the v3 Query engine would resolve the issue. Prioritized customer migration to v3.

Case was handled in a timely manner and customer seemed happy. Not sure why he provided a 3.

SR# **2111090060002164** - Product improvement required extents to be realicated. As a result storage became a bottle neck. Once realication was complete cluster started working as expected.

Could we have automatically allocated additional storage accounts and if so would that have prevented this issue?

SR#**2110210050000312**- Dodo Pizza - Review done by cnisulescu. Customer reported an error while executing an error. CSS raised ICM 269034392 after 4 days in which additional questions and information have been asked from the customer as the error provided showed backend issue.The response from PG was that back in May this service encountered a bug that corrupted some extents and were not removed. So as luck would have it, this query is hitting that bad extent.In parallel, the customer escalated the case directly to ADX PM and the discussion continued until the solution has been provided. CSS reached out to ADX PM for an update and received the separate email thread with the response provided directly to the customer. Recovery has been initiated with the customer and waiting for a response and as a learning, we need to improve DTS and DTC and act as one Microsoft with all the parties involved.

SR# **2109080060001895** - Trend Micro - Issue doing export to Parquet format. Was able to do export to csv. Believed to be cluster size issue. Suggesting increasing the number of nodes. Couldn't verify solution because customer didn't want to scale up.
How do we prevent this from happening again?
Better logging and error message so customer knows if cluster performance might be causing issue.
Added by shawnj - As we checked with PG, it was caused by a product issue (migrating '.export' related functionality, ETA is the end of this CY). From CSS perspective, another customer care call after Teams chat confirmation, and sent out detailed case summary for customer records would be better.

SR# **2111010050001493** - - Customer accidently deleted resource group containing ADX cluster and was trying to get cluster restored. Escalated to operations who confirmed that restoration wasn't possible. Review done by cnisulescu : case solved in 2 days, customer was not happy that while there is a clear warning message when deleting the resource group, CSS could not provide a workaround. CSS escalated to operations to ask for help but there was no other alternative. Communicacation and case have been managed well.

SR# **2111120060002432** -- Case was handled properly. Customer asking about Event Hub System properties when content is sent as gzip. Proper guidance was given.

### Oct 2021
SR# **2109150060002456** - Trend Micro - Customer having issue scaling up the cluster. Stating that after scale up you had to restart the cluster to get it to work. Support Engineer tested with same SKU and everything works. Timeing seemed to be the issue as after the portal said the operation was complete you still had to wait for cluster to be running and operational.

How do we prevent this from happening again?
Better notification of 1) When scale up operation is still happening 2) When the scale up operation is complete

SR# **2109150040004202** - (ICM#261823277) Canadian National Railway - Customer could not scale ADX cluster gettting quota error message. Cluster was running on an unsupported sku and once updated on the backend issue was resolved.

Why it happened? Bug that has been resolved allow them to be running cluster on unsupported sku

How do we prevent this from happening again? Bug fix should prevent this in the future

What went wrong? Case opened on 9-15 and not resolved until 10-6. I believe TTM was the major issue in this case. Primary reason for TTM was ADX Operations team availability with holiday season.

SR# **2109220050000533** - Lind GmbH - Materialized view not working for the customer. Running the query manually would return reslts but MV was not being populated.

Why it happened? Bug in the parser. Customer was naming the aggregate field 1x (ex: 1x=avg()) and even though this works in interactive query it caused parsing error for MV.

How do we prevent this from happning again? Bug fix should resolve parsing error.

SR# **2109130060000811** - Customer ingesting from Event Hub and was looking to ingest historical data. Any data landing into Event Hub prior to data connection will not be ingested and this is by design.

SR# **2109140050002034** - Customer havine issues querying external table due to configuration issue. Issue was resolved after call with customer and customer was satisfied.

SR# **2109220040007715** - Customer was getting errors connecting to the database. Issue was due to the size of the cluster and cache utilization. After customer moved off of DEV sku the issue went away.

### Sep 2021
SR# **2109060050002187** - Adobe - Query timeouts on customer cluster due to bug in Web UI. Hotfix was pushed to fix the issue. This was control commands not completing on cluster. 

How do we prevent this from happening again?
More testing of updates before pushing out to clusters.

SR# **2108180050001990** - QIAGEN GmbH - Customer was getting different results from regex in Kusto query between Kusto Explorer and Web UI. This was due to the way that the Web UI parses the new line character. A modification was provided for the Web UI query that returned the expected results.

Why it happened? WebUI handles new line conversion differently. Customer need to utilize following -- replace_regex(stage,@"\r?\n",'",\r\n"')

How do we prevent this from happening again?
1) Is there a way to have both web and Kusto Explorer parse the same?
2) Is there documentation that explains these differences?

SR# **2109020040004689** - (ICM#259551302)ExxonMobil - ADX metrics aggregation not behaving as expected. Max and Min aggregations values are missing. Update was pushed to resolve the issue.

SR# **2107130050000809** - In this incident, CSS team didn't provide accurate response to the customer. After doing further analytics, CSS (and Ops team) discovered that Slow ingestion was due to not having enough resources for data management service which caused ingestion latency to increase. Feedback to Ravit's team for additional insights, 4. Have Ingestion team perform a case review to understand why DM autoscale didn't work and how we can avoid this.

SR# **2107220060002842** - Customer was using LogStash to ingest to ADX and the interval they were running at was causing the ingestion file to be too large. Once the interval was modified the ingestion to ADX happened as expected. CSS team response was good.TEST CN

SR# **2108100040006411** - Customer asking for query to see usage by ADX Dashboards. Case was handled well and solution was provided to see usage based on dashboard guid. Customer wanted ability to connect GUID to display name through the query. This is not supported due to privacy concerns and by design.

SR# **2106090060003494** - This was an advisory case that was handled appropriately. Proper information was provided to the customer.

SR# **2108040060002767** - Question regarding max table size. Ticket handled properly and customer was satisfied

Possibly could have been deflected with proper "Common Solution"

### July 2021

SR# **2106160050002390** - Customer tried using Continuous export to run export at specific time that is not supported. CSS team response was valid to suggest customer to leverage ADF to complete the export as a scheduled activity.

SR## **2107090050001782** - Customer was ingesting multiline json and wanted a system property from Event Hub to be populated in each of the rows. This isn't supported and the support engineer pointed him to our documentation that stated the same. Customer was satisfied with the response.

SR## **2107010010003001** - Case was handled correctly by CSS. Issue was SKU picked by customer. A Common Solution or Diagnostic during ticket submission could have helped permit ticket.

SR## **2107010050001370** - Customer stated there was issue ingesting from Event Hub but by the time the ticket was received the issue was resolved.

SR## **2107060060002537** - Couldn't use one-click ingestion because SAS token not accepted by their security team. Trying to use Managed Identity of the cluster but that is not supported. Customer solved the problem by using the Python SDK.

### June 2021


SR# **2106010060002275** - No idea why customer provided CSAT score as 1. Customer wanted to review how to monitor # of databases that are created on a cluster to alert if that number exceeds 10,000. CSAT could have certainly followed up on some justification on what is that they are trying to do. Still CSAT provided multiple ways customer can setup such an alert. Customer not provided by verbatim. No IcM ticket. Ticket was created by Partner - M&M Software GmbH (any one working with them? or want to join the customer followup meeting?). Customer is running D11_v2 (2 nodes) as engine.

### May 2021

SR# **2105100040002158** - 
What happened?
Data Management service (DM) is an internal component of Azure Data Explorer. Its responsible for reading events from Event Hub and ingesting them into the Engine where the data is indexed and cached for querying. DM nodes automatically scales in/out and up/down based on the resource (CPU and Memory) utilization. On May 9th, our automation detected low resource utilization on the DM service and decided to downgrade to from D13 SKU to D3 SKU. The intent here is to save customer money. Unfortunately, it failed mid-way and the DM stopped to process the queue for nearly 24 hours. The issue was mitigated on May 10th with a restart and bumping up the SKU to D13 for faster recovery. 

Why it happened?
The exact root case of the provisioning failure\service cache is still under investigation. There is an automation that detects failures and performs first level recovery, but this automation was not triggered due to a gap in our incident ticketing process.

What were the gap in our incident ticketing process?
Morgan Stanley cluster is running in a VNET injected mode. We need certain outbound IP address whitelisted to send telemetry back to our monitoring systems. On April 27th, our monitoring systems detected a VNET issue due to missing IP address. A Severity -2 alert was logged and we informed Morgan Stanley via Azure communication to add the missing IP Address. While awaiting for the fix from the customer side (which has unpredictable time), the Sev 2 ticket was downgraded to a Sev 4 ticket to unclutter the live site ticket queue. The IP changes was applied on April 28th by Morgan Stanley, but the ticket did not auto close because it required manual review. So when the DM failed on May 9th the alert was corelating to the open ticket that was in the Sev 4 queue and did not get the required attentions from the support system, including the automation to do the first level recovery.

How do we prevent this from happening again?
1.	We made changes to our ticket priority and ticket auto-close process so that we dont miss the new alerts in the future.
2.	Analyzing your burst workload we recommend running the cluster at a minimum capacity that is ready to take on initial load as you start ingesting the data. We have now set your DM service to minimum 10 nodes to prevent it from scaling down and to give head start to deal with the burst ingestion. However, your workload need 28-30 DM nodes to address the burst ingestion volume. 
3.	We are looking at adding exclusion list for preventing downgrade of the nodes for dealing with burst ingestion scenarios.
4.	We are working on a new feature of subnet delegation which is expected to be available by end of this month. This will eliminate the need for our customers to manage ADX monitoring related IP address. We will share the details as soon the feature is available. 

I also believe that there were gaps in EH partition management and some investigation is taking place.


SR# **2105050010002205** - This was an issue where customer was ingesting JSON data and for some of the files were getting ingested with blank rows. Dev team was not able to reproduce the issue at the begining and later it was identified as the issue with large file size. Open questions are why there were no relevent ingestion failures? Customer is Daimler and IcM incident is 239829827.

SR# **2104130010004122** - Customer tried adding his account to a group and  added that group as admin on ADX Database. Propogation of his account permission on the group took time and that is why customer provided low score for this ticket. This is not ADX issue. No further action.

There is a bug open for this "Bug 8900828: VNet cluster - throw an error on delete/suspend if the LB is connected to PLS" - https://msazure.visualstudio.com/One/_workitems/edit/8900828. SR# **2103260050000756** - Customer was using a Dev SKU and was running into control command throttling due to excessive set-or-append operation that were run using Logic Apps. ### March 2021

SR# **2103150050000413** - This issue was not escalated to Ops team for investigation. Per ticket summary, customer was using Light Ingest to backfill data and client side process ran fine but no data was ingested. Upon review by Support Engineer, he identified few files that ADX failed to ingest and provided feedback to customer on doing ingestion without those files. Customer was trying to learn on why those specific files were failing. Few suggestions were provided by Support Engineer without due dilligence like stop/start of cluster, delete table and recreate was not a good set to work with. Issue self miitigated and customer closed the ticket.

SR# **2103110060002647** - Low CSAT seems justified on why customer had to whitelist all of Microsoft SAW namespace in their Firewall so SE team can access their Kusto Cluster and troubleshoot the issue. No much I could gather from the ticket. Since Customer cluster was behing VNET, Ops team need to access the cluster to troubleshoot. I would like to understand what capablity we are missing? Granting access to IPs is not something many customers are comfortable doing or can only do after exception from their security team. (IcM Ticket - https://portal.microsofticm.com/imp/v3/incidents/details/231387093/home)

SR# **2103050040004996** - Low CSAT could be due to incomplete guidance on how to setup Auto Scale using metrics. In this ticket, customer setup very aggressive auto scale setting which was getting triggered multiple times and impacted cluster availability. Guidance was provided to help customer optimize the rule set. I believe we should review this to understand how to best enable guardrails in auto scale to avoid such issues or add Resource Health incidation of excessive scale operation and add guidance there. (IcM ticket - https://portal.microsofticm.com/imp/v3/incidents/details/230951691/home) 

SR# **2102230020004372** - Low CSAT from customer on the product bug where engine was trying to write the MD to a deleted container. 
More info - "We identified a bug in metadata which cause the delta file to be overridden in the following case:
1.	The cluster had a restart or the Admin node was replaced
2.	The first operation after the restart triggered writing of the metadata file artifact in the MD storage (only certain operations such as create/drop/alter table/function cause this)
3.	Another restart happened before object file was written (object files are written after the delta file reaches a certain size limit)  because of this, we prefer installing the hotfix in the beginning of next week, to allow clusters to recover on their own.
 
If all the above happen (low probability), this can cause data loss or errors regarding missing extent containers."

Summary - Issue was fixed by manually updating the MD file. Is there a plan to address to fix these scenarios or take manual action to correct the MD file. (IcM Ticket -  https://portal.microsofticm.com/imp/v3/incidents/details/229360067/home)

SR# **121021225000685** - Low CSAT could be because as part of the review, we (ADX, Event Hub and Azure Functions) couldn't establish the source of data duplication. CSS Provided instructions on what to capture next time when that happens (IcM Ticket - https://portal.microsofticm.com/imp/v3/incidents/details/228321102/home)

### Jan 2021

SR# **121010626004294** - This ticket was created by an internal customer. Since customer used his AME creds, Email follow ups were undelivered. When CSS team reached out to internal customer for follow-up over Chat, customer closed the ticket with no follow-up and provided low score. Follow-up with customer will be scheduled to understand the experience and to learn more about the root cause of the issue.

SR# **121011224005467** - This was an interesting case where Customer enabled Firewall on their Event Hub and ingestion into Kusto stopped working. Ideal way to fix was to deploy both Event Hub and Kusto Cluster into a VNET but that was not possible. As a workaround, Kusto Cluster managed identity was created and was given explicit permission on the event hub. Long term work is still being analyzed. 

SR# **121011324000779** - There are few important points about this ticket - 1. Customer requested support for cluster not starting which was resolved by itself and ticket transitioned to ingestion latency issue. 2. There were delays in getting the response to the customer and also not clear direction on how to make requested changes to the service. There are some improvement items in order to get better.

tiles.title: Control Plane Error Count
tiles.query:
let ReportingPeriod = startofmonth(datetime_add('month', -3, now()));
EventServiceEntries 
| where TIMESTAMP >= ReportingPeriod
| where status == "Failed" and resourceProvider == "Microsoft.Kusto"
| summarize count() by Month=startofmonth(TIMESTAMP)
| order by Month asc
| extend Change = (count_-prev(count_))/prev(count_)*100
| extend Month=format_datetime(Month, "MM-yyyy")

tiles.title: Error Message Improvement
tiles.query: The goal of this effort is to have teams review all of their error messages which users encounter and ensure they are valuable. This includes both control plane and data plane error messages. Teams should familiarize themselves with the style guidance for error messages and ensure they are following appropriately. When teams identify gaps in product and support during the review, they should create work items for further product improvement

tiles.title: Top 10 Failed Status (Last Month)
tiles.query:
let ReportingPeriod = startofmonth(datetime_add('month', -1, now()));
let CurrentMonth = startofmonth(now());
EventServiceEntries 
| where TIMESTAMP >= ReportingPeriod and TIMESTAMP < CurrentMonth
| where status == "Failed" and resourceProvider == "Microsoft.Kusto" //and operationName == @"Microsoft.Kusto/clusters/databases/write"
| project TIMESTAMP, subscriptionId, resourceUri, tenantId  , StatusCode=subStatus, properties
| extend  statusmessage = extractjson("$.statusMessage", properties)
| extend code = parse_json(tostring(parse_json(tostring(parse_json(properties).statusMessage)).error)).code
| mv-expand details= parse_json(tostring(parse_json(tostring(parse_json(properties).statusMessage)).error)).details
| extend pricode = details.code
| extend code = iff(isempty(pricode),code, pricode)
| extend Code = parse_json(tostring(parse_json(tostring(parse_json(properties).statusMessage)))).Error.Code
| mv-expand Details= parse_json(tostring(parse_json(tostring(parse_json(properties).statusMessage)))).Error.Details
| extend PriCode = Details.Code
| extend Code = iff(isempty(PriCode),Code, PriCode)
| extend message = iif(parse_json(tostring(parse_json(properties).statusMessage)).message=="", parse_json(tostring(parse_json(tostring(parse_json(properties).statusMessage)).error)).message, parse_json(tostring(parse_json(properties).statusMessage)).message)
| extend Message = parse_json(tostring(parse_json(tostring(parse_json(properties).statusMessage)))).Error.Message
| extend Message = iff(isempty(Message), message,Message)
| extend StatusCode = iff(isempty(Code), iff(isempty(code), StatusCode,code), Code)
| project-away  properties, message, Code, code, PriCode, pricode
| summarize count() by StatusCode
| top 10 by count_

tiles.title: Self-Help Success
tiles.query:
let ReportingPeriod = startofmonth(datetime_add('month', -3, now()));
range Timestamp from datetime_add('month', -3, now()) to now() step 1d
| summarize by Timestamp=startofmonth(Timestamp)
| join kind=leftouter
(
cluster('https://U360sec.kusto.windows.net').database('KPISupportData').Selfhelpdeflection
| where ProductId == 16602
| where usageTime >= ReportingPeriod
| summarize NumeratorValue = sum(numeratorQuantity), DenominatorValue = sum(denominatorQuantity) by Month=startofmonth(usageTime)
| extend Quantity = iff(DenominatorValue == 0, double(null), NumeratorValue/DenominatorValue)
) on $left.Timestamp == $right.Month
| order by Timestamp asc
| extend Month=format_datetime(Timestamp, "MM-yyyy")
| project Month, ['Self-Help Success (%)']=round(Quantity*100, 2)

tiles.title: Previous Month
tiles.query:
let ReportingPeriod = startofmonth(datetime_add('month', -1, now()));
let CurrentMonth = startofmonth(now())-1tick;
let totalTicketsStarted= toscalar(cluster('https://U360sec.kusto.windows.net').database('KPISupportData').Selfhelpdeflection
| where ProductId == 16602
| where usageTime >= ReportingPeriod and usageTime < startofmonth(now())
| where isnotempty( SupportTopicL2)
| summarize TotalCount=dcount(WorkflowId) );
cluster('https://U360sec.kusto.windows.net').database('KPISupportData').Selfhelpdeflection
| where ProductId == 16602
| where usageTime >= ReportingPeriod and usageTime < startofmonth(now())
| where IsAbandoned == "Yes" and IsDeflected == "Yes" and isnotempty(ArticleId)
| summarize DefCount=dcount(WorkflowId),Solution_List=make_set(SolutionType) by SupportTopicL2, SupportTopicL3
//| summarize DefCount=dcount(WorkflowId) by SupportTopicL2, SupportTopicL3
| join kind=fullouter (KPISupportData
    | where CreatedDateTime >= ReportingPeriod and CreatedDateTime < CurrentMonth
    | summarize SubTickets=count(),NumICMs=countif(isnotempty(RelatedICM_IDs)),ICMS=make_set(RelatedICM_IDs) by SupportTopicL2, SupportTopicL3
) on SupportTopicL2, SupportTopicL3  
| extend DefCount=iif(isempty(DefCount), 0, DefCount)
| where isnotempty( SupportTopicL21)
| project SupportTOpicL2=SupportTopicL21, SupportTopicL3=SupportTopicL31, TotalStarted=SubTickets+DefCount, DefCount, SubTickets, PctofTickets=round((todouble(SubTickets+DefCount)/todouble(totalTicketsStarted)) * 100,2), PctDeflected=round((todouble(DefCount)/todouble(totalTicketsStarted)) * 100,2), NumICMs, ICMS, Solution_List
| top 10 by TotalStarted

tiles.title: Ticket Stats (prev 3 months)
tiles.query:
let ReportingPeriod = startofmonth(datetime_add('month', -3, now()));
range Timestamp from datetime_add('month', -3, now()) to now() step 1d
| summarize by Timestamp=startofmonth(Timestamp)
| join kind=leftouter
(
cluster('https://U360sec.kusto.windows.net').database('KPISupportData').Selfhelpdeflection
| where ProductId == 16602
| where usageTime >= ReportingPeriod
| summarize NumeratorValue = sum(numeratorQuantity), DenominatorValue = sum(denominatorQuantity) by Month=startofmonth(usageTime)
| extend Quantity = iff(DenominatorValue == 0, double(null), NumeratorValue/DenominatorValue)
) on $left.Timestamp == $right.Month
| join kind=leftouter 
(
    KPISupportData
    | where CreatedDateTime >= ReportingPeriod
    | summarize CasesCreated=count(), ICMCreated=countif(isnotempty(RelatedICM_IDs)),
    v3Migration=countif(IssueDescription has 'v3' and (IssueDescription has 'Upgrade' or IssueDescription has 'Migrate')) by Month=startofmonth(CreatedDateTime)
) on Month
| extend DeflectedCases=round(CasesCreated*Quantity,0),TotalCases=round(CasesCreated*(1+Quantity),0)
| project Month=format_datetime(Timestamp, "MM-yyyy"),TotalCases, DeflectedCases, CasesCreated, DeflectionPct=strcat(round(Quantity*100,2),'%'), ICMs=ICMCreated, v3Migration, PercentICM=strcat(round(((todouble(ICMCreated)-todouble(v3Migration))/todouble(CasesCreated)) * 100,2),'%')
| order by Month

tiles.title: Ratio: CSS Support Cases to Running Clusters
tiles.query:
range TimeStamp from startofmonth(ago(90d)) to now() step 1d
| summarize by TimeStamp=endofmonth(TimeStamp)
| join kind=leftouter
(
    KPISupportData
    | summarize CasesCreated = count() by TimeStamp=endofmonth(CreatedDateTime)
) on TimeStamp
| join kind=leftouter 
(
    KPISupportData
    | summarize CasesClosed = count() by TimeStamp=endofmonth(ClosedDateTime)
) on TimeStamp
| join kind=leftouter
(
    cluster('kuskusdfv3.westeurope').database('Kuskus').DimClusters
    | where TIMESTAMP >= startofmonth(ago(90d))
    | where CustomerType == 'External'
    | where Cluster !startswith "INGEST-"
    | extend Day=endofday(TIMESTAMP)
    | summarize arg_max(TIMESTAMP,*) by Cluster, Day
    | where State=='Running'
    | summarize RunningClusters=count() by TimeStamp=endofmonth(TIMESTAMP)
) on TimeStamp
| project TimeStamp,CreatedRatio=todouble(CasesCreated)/todouble(RunningClusters), CloasedRatio=todouble(CasesClosed)/todouble(RunningClusters)
| order by TimeStamp
| extend CreatedMOM=CreatedRatio-prev(CreatedRatio), CloasedMOM=CloasedRatio-prev(CloasedRatio)

tiles.title: ICM by Support Topic (prev 3 months)
tiles.query:
let ReportingPeriod = startofmonth(datetime_add('month', -3, now()));
KPISupportData
    | where CreatedDateTime >= ReportingPeriod
    | summarize CasesCreated=count(), ICMCreated=countif(isnotempty(RelatedICM_IDs)),
    v3Migration=countif(IssueDescription has 'v3' and (IssueDescription has 'Upgrade' or IssueDescription has 'Migrate')) by Month=startofmonth(CreatedDateTime), Topic=strcat(SupportTopicL2,'-',SupportTopicL3)
    | extend ICM=iif(ICMCreated-v3Migration<0,0,ICMCreated-v3Migration), Cases=CasesCreated-v3Migration
    | project Month, Topic, Cases, ICM, Pct=round((todouble(ICM))/(todouble(Cases))*100,2)
    | top 15 by Cases
    | order by Pct desc
